20110119023119.000|20110119023123.000|CC1|    FOR OVER 400 YEARS,

20110119023231.000|20110119023231.000|CC1|AND BECAUSE IT'S BEEN TAKING

20110119023246.000|20110119023248.000|CC1|SO THIS IS WHAT IT'S ALL ABOUT. 
20110119023248.000|20110119023248.000|CC1|    I THINK THAT SHE'S          
20110119023248.000|20110119023251.000|CC1|REPRESENTING THE GIRL WHO'S     
20110119023251.000|20110119023251.000|CC1|SUPPOSED TO HAVE STOLEN         
20110119023251.000|20110119023253.000|CC1|A VIRGIN MARY FROM A CHURCH

20110119023257.000|20110119023257.000|CC1|    THAT'S THE POINT OF

20110119023311.000|20110119023314.000|CC1|    SIGNIFICANCE REMAINS,       
20110119023314.000|20110119023314.000|CC1|    THE WHOLE THING BEING

20110119023318.000|20110119023345.000|CC1|    [CHEERING AND APPLAUSE]     
20110119023345.000|20110119023345.000|CC1|THE TRAIN SYSTEM IN BELGIUM IS  
20110119023345.000|20110119023348.000|CC1|VERY EFFICIENT AND REASONABLE.  
20110119023348.000|20110119023348.000|CC1|    AFTER A SLIGHT DETOUR TO    
20110119023348.000|20110119023351.000|CC1|    WATERLOO, I'M HEADING TO    
20110119023351.000|20110119023353.000|CC1|THE LITTLE TOWN OF HASSELT.     
20110119023353.000|20110119023353.000|CC1|THE JOURNEY TAKES ABOUT 75      
20110119023353.000|20110119023407.000|CC1|MINUTES, AND IT COSTS ABOUT $10.
20110119023407.000|20110119023409.000|CC1|            [GUNFIRE]           
20110119023409.000|20110119023411.000|CC1|        [MEN YELLING]           
20110119023411.000|20110119023411.000|CC1|THE DATE IS JUN 15, THE YEAR    
20110119023411.000|20110119023417.000|CC1|1851, THE LOCATION WATERLOO,    
20110119023417.000|20110119023417.000|CC1|    ABOUT 10 MILES SOUTH        
20110119023417.000|20110119023420.000|CC1|        OF BRUSSELS.            
20110119023420.000|20110119023420.000|CC1|    TWO MIGHTY ARMIES           
20110119023420.000|20110119023423.000|CC1|    MEET HEAD TO HEAD.          
20110119023423.000|20110119023423.000|CC1|FRANCE'S NAPOLEON BONAPARTE     
20110119023423.000|20110119023425.000|CC1|    AND BRITAIN'S               
20110119023425.000|20110119023425.000|CC1|DUKE OF WELLINGTON LEADING      
20110119023425.000|20110119023428.000|CC1|THE BELGIAN, DUTCH, GERMAN,     
20110119023428.000|20110119023428.000|CC1|AND PRUSSIAN ALLIES, FACE EACH  
20110119023428.000|20110119023433.000|CC1|OTHER ACROSS A SHALLOW VALLEY.  
20110119023433.000|20110119023433.000|CC1|EVERY 5 YEARS, THIS BATTLE      
20110119023433.000|20110119023436.000|CC1|IS REENACTED IN WATERLOO        
20110119023436.000|20110119023441.000|CC1|AND ON THE ACTUAL BATTLEFIELDS. 
20110119023441.000|20110119023441.000|CC1|WHEW! I THINK THESE STEPS ARE   
20110119023441.000|20110119023444.000|CC1|    GONNA BE MY WATERLOO.       
20110119023444.000|20110119023448.000|CC1|            OHH.                
20110119023448.000|20110119023450.000|CC1|            [GUNFIRE]           
20110119023450.000|20110119023456.000|CC1|        [EXPLOSIONS]            
20110119023456.000|20110119023456.000|CC1|THESE ARE THE FIELDS WHERE      
20110119023456.000|20110119023457.000|CC1|THE BATTLE OF WATERLOO          
20110119023457.000|20110119023457.000|CC1|WAS FOUGHT, AND A PRESERVATION  
20110119023457.000|20110119023501.000|CC1|ORDER'S BEEN PUT ON THEM,       
20110119023501.000|20110119023501.000|CC1|    SO THEY'RE EXACTLY          
20110119023501.000|20110119023503.000|CC1|    AS THEY WERE IN 1815.       
20110119023503.000|20110119023503.000|CC1|    YOU CAN SEE THE KIND OF     
20110119023503.000|20110119023506.000|CC1|    THE RIDGES IN THE LAND,     
20110119023506.000|20110119023506.000|CC1|AND EVEN THE FARMHOUSES ARE     
20110119023506.000|20110119023509.000|CC1|EXACTLY AS THEY WERE.           
20110119023509.000|20110119023511.000|CC1|NOTHING CAN BE BUILT ON THIS.   
20110119023511.000|20110119023511.000|CC1|WELLINGTON AND HIS TROOPS       
20110119023511.000|20110119023514.000|CC1|WERE ON THIS RIDGE OVER HERE,   
20110119023514.000|20110119023514.000|CC1|AND NAPOLEON WAS ON THAT        
20110119023514.000|20110119023518.000|CC1|RIDGE OVER THERE FACING THEM,   
20110119023518.000|20110119023518.000|CC1|    ONE KILOMETER APART,        
20110119023518.000|20110119023521.000|CC1|    AND IT WAS CARNAGE.         
20110119023521.000|20110119023521.000|CC1|APPARENTLY 15,000 MEN WERE      
20110119023521.000|20110119023524.000|CC1|KILLED BETWEEN THE HOURS        
20110119023524.000|20110119023524.000|CC1|    OF IN 11:00 THE MORNING     
20110119023524.000|20110119023527.000|CC1|    AND 8:00 IN THE EVENING,    
20110119023527.000|20110119023527.000|CC1|    AND ANOTHER 20,000 IN       
20110119023527.000|20110119023530.000|CC1|    THE FOLLOWING DAYS          
20110119023530.000|20110119023531.000|CC1|    OF THEIR INJURIES.          
20110119023531.000|20110119023532.000|CC1|        [EXPLOSION]             
20110119023532.000|20110119023532.000|CC1|THE ALLIES WERE VICTORIOUS      
20110119023532.000|20110119023535.000|CC1|AND SUCCEEDED IN STOPPING       
20110119023535.000|20110119023538.000|CC1|FRANCE'S ADVANCE ACROSS EUROPE. 
20110119023538.000|20110119023538.000|CC1|    WELLINGTON'S VICTORY        
20110119023538.000|20110119023538.000|CC1|    CHANGED THE COURSE          
20110119023538.000|20110119023541.000|CC1|    OF HISTORY IN EUROPE.       
20110119023541.000|20110119023541.000|CC1|    FRANCE'S DEFEAT WAS         
20110119023541.000|20110119023544.000|CC1|    THE DOWNFALL OF NAPOLEON,   
20110119023544.000|20110119023544.000|CC1|AND HE WAS IMMEDIATELY EXILED   
20110119023544.000|20110119023547.000|CC1|TO THE ISLAND OF SAINT HELENA   
20110119023547.000|20110119023547.000|CC1|    TO LIVE OUT HIS DAYS        
20110119023547.000|20110119023550.000|CC1|        IN SOLITUDE.            
20110119023550.000|20110119023550.000|CC1|IT CHANGED THE COURSE           
20110119023550.000|20110119023553.000|CC1|OF EUROPEAN HISTORY FOREVER,    
20110119023553.000|20110119023553.000|CC1|    AND OF COURSE, I WOULDN'T   
20110119023553.000|20110119023555.000|CC1|    BE SPEAKING ENGLISH         
20110119023555.000|20110119023557.000|CC1|        HAD NAPOLEON WON.       
20110119023557.000|20110119023557.000|CC1|    MIND YOU, I MIGHT HAVE      
20110119023557.000|20110119023606.000|CC1|    BEEN EATING BETTER FOOD.    
20110119023606.000|20110119023606.000|CC1|        ANYWAY, ON FROM         
20110119023606.000|20110119023610.000|CC1|THE SOBERING FIELDS OF WATERLOO 
20110119023610.000|20110119023610.000|CC1|AND NORTHEAST TO HASSELT TO     
20110119023610.000|20110119023616.000|CC1|PUT MYSELF IN A BETTER SPIRIT.  
20110119023616.000|20110119023616.000|CC1|ONE OF BELGIUM'S NATIONAL       
20110119023616.000|20110119023619.000|CC1|DRINKS IS SOME ANCIENT OLD      
20110119023619.000|20110119023620.000|CC1|    STUFF CALLED GENIEVRE.      
20110119023620.000|20110119023620.000|CC1|IT'S KIND OF LIKE GIN EXCEPT    
20110119023620.000|20110119023623.000|CC1|THAT IT CAME BEFORE GIN.        
20110119023623.000|20110119023623.000|CC1|    IN FACT, GIN WAS            
20110119023623.000|20110119023625.000|CC1|    MADE FROM IT, AND I'VE      
20110119023625.000|20110119023625.000|CC1|COME HERE BECAUSE I'M GONNA     
20110119023625.000|20110119023628.000|CC1|MEET SOME PEOPLE WHO MAKE       
20110119023628.000|20110119023628.000|CC1|THE STUFF, DRINK THE STUFF,     
20110119023628.000|20110119023631.000|CC1|    AND CELEBRATE IT            
20110119023631.000|20110119023638.000|CC1|    IN THE OLD-FASHIONED WAY.   
20110119023638.000|20110119023643.000|CC1|        [STEAM HISSING]         
20110119023643.000|20110119023643.000|CC1|THIS IS JAN,                    
20110119023643.000|20110119023643.000|CC1|THE MAGICIAN WHO MAKES          
20110119023643.000|20110119023647.000|CC1|THIS STUFF HAPPEN.              
20110119023647.000|20110119023647.000|CC1|JAN, WHAT IS IT?                
20110119023647.000|20110119023649.000|CC1|WHAT IS GENIEVRE?               
20110119023649.000|20110119023649.000|CC1|            YES, GENIEVRE IS    
20110119023649.000|20110119023651.000|CC1|            MADE FROM GRAINS.   
20110119023651.000|20110119023651.000|CC1|            THAT'S MOST         
20110119023651.000|20110119023653.000|CC1|            IMPORTANT.          
20110119023653.000|20110119023653.000|CC1|            WE USE MALT         
20110119023653.000|20110119023658.000|CC1|            AND RYE AND BARLEY. 
20110119023658.000|20110119023658.000|CC1|            WE USE ALSO         
20110119023658.000|20110119023701.000|CC1|            VERY OLD SEEDS      
20110119023701.000|20110119023701.000|CC1|            FROM, LIKE,         
20110119023701.000|20110119023704.000|CC1|            THE JUNIPER.        
20110119023704.000|20110119023704.000|CC1|            JUNIPER'S           
20110119023704.000|20110119023704.000|CC1|            A VERY OLD SEED.    
20110119023704.000|20110119023706.000|CC1|            YOU KNOW THAT.      
20110119023706.000|20110119023706.000|CC1|AND THE JUNIPER,                
20110119023706.000|20110119023708.000|CC1|OF COURSE,                      
20110119023708.000|20110119023708.000|CC1|IS THE FAMOUS ONE               
20110119023708.000|20110119023708.000|CC1|WHICH GIVES IT                  
20110119023708.000|20110119023710.000|CC1|THE FLAVOR, ISN'T IT?           
20110119023710.000|20110119023710.000|CC1|            YES, THAT'S         
20110119023710.000|20110119023710.000|CC1|            MOST IMPORTANT,     
20110119023710.000|20110119023713.000|CC1|            THE FLAVORS.        
20110119023713.000|20110119023713.000|CC1|SO WHERE DID YOU                
20110119023713.000|20110119023714.000|CC1|LEARN THIS?                     
20110119023714.000|20110119023714.000|CC1|            THERE ARE OLD       
20110119023714.000|20110119023717.000|CC1|            DISTILLERS.         
20110119023717.000|20110119023719.000|CC1|            THAT'S 20 YEARS AGO.
20110119023719.000|20110119023719.000|CC1|            IT WAS THEN         
20110119023719.000|20110119023721.000|CC1|            NOT A PROBLEM.      
20110119023721.000|20110119023721.000|CC1|            NOW THERE           
20110119023721.000|20110119023723.000|CC1|            ARE NO DISTILLERS,  
20110119023723.000|20110119023723.000|CC1|            AND I'M JUST        
20110119023723.000|20110119023726.000|CC1|            ON MY OWN NOW,      
20110119023726.000|20110119023727.000|CC1|            AND I MAKE THIS ONE.
20110119023727.000|20110119023727.000|CC1|            I THINK IT'S GOOD,  
20110119023727.000|20110119023729.000|CC1|            THOUGH, NO?         
20110119023729.000|20110119023730.000|CC1|IT'S VERY GOOD.                 
20110119023730.000|20110119023730.000|CC1|YOU'RE THE LAST                 
20110119023730.000|20110119023731.000|CC1|DISTILLER USING                 
20110119023731.000|20110119023731.000|CC1|THE OLD-FASHIONED               
20110119023731.000|20110119023733.000|CC1|TECHNIQUES?                     
20110119023733.000|20110119023734.000|CC1|                YES.            
20110119023734.000|20110119023752.000|CC1|    [SINGING IN FLEMISH]        
20110119023752.000|20110119023752.000|CC1|        THIS IS A GENIEVRE BAR, 
20110119023752.000|20110119023752.000|CC1|        AND YOU'VE GOT QUITE

20110119023758.000|20110119023758.000|CC1|        THOUGH I DON'T SEE

20110119023805.000|20110119023814.000|CC1|    [SINGING CONTINUES]         
20110119023814.000|20110119023822.000|CC1|    [CHEERING AND APPLAUSE]     
20110119023822.000|20110119023822.000|CC1|I'M HEADED SOUTH, FORGING MY    
20110119023822.000|20110119023825.000|CC1|WAY THROUGH BELGIUM'S LANGUAGE  
20110119023825.000|20110119023825.000|CC1|BARRIER FOR SOME ADVENTURE IN   
20110119023825.000|20110119023832.000|CC1|THE FRENCH-SPEAKING ARDENNES.   
20110119023832.000|20110119023832.000|CC1|ONE OF THE ATTRACTIONS OF       
20110119023832.000|20110119023834.000|CC1|THE ARDENNES IS TO GET UP,      
20110119023834.000|20110119023834.000|CC1|    GET OUT, GET ACTIVE,        
20110119023834.000|20110119023837.000|CC1|    AND BE ADVENTUROUS.         
20110119023837.000|20110119023837.000|CC1|PEOPLE COME HERE FROM ALL OVER  
20110119023837.000|20110119023841.000|CC1|THE PLACE JUST TO GET EXTREME.  
20110119023841.000|20110119023841.000|CC1|    HELLO? GUYS, YOU CAN        
20110119023841.000|20110119023843.000|CC1|    LET ME UP NOW.              
20110119023843.000|20110119023843.000|CC1|    NOW YOU CAN DO ANYTHING     
20110119023843.000|20110119023850.000|CC1|    FROM THIS--HA HA...         
20110119023850.000|20110119023854.000|CC1|        WHOO--TO THIS!          
20110119023854.000|20110119023902.000|CC1|            HA HA HA!           
20110119023902.000|20110119023902.000|CC1|        YOU CAN BURN

20110119024110.000|20110119024110.000|CC1|    IT'S CALLED ESCABECHE,      
20110119024110.000|20110119024113.000|CC1|        AND IT'S FISH,

20110119024113.000|20110119024115.000|CC1|AND IN THIS CASE IT'S TROUT,

20110119024136.000|20110119024139.000|CC1|    COR. NOW THAT'S GOOD.       
20110119024139.000|20110119024142.000|CC1|    PUTS HAIRS ON YOUR CHEST.

20110119024153.000|20110119024153.000|CC1|    I'M HEADED OVER TO THAT     
20110119024153.000|20110119024156.000|CC1|    VILLAGE OVER THERE, WHICH   
20110119024156.000|20110119024156.000|CC1|    CALLED HAN SUR LESSE,

20110119024159.000|20110119024159.000|CC1|GO THERE IS BECAUSE IT'S GOT

20110119024219.000|20110119024219.000|CC1|    IT'S LIKE A FAIRY TALE,     
20110119024219.000|20110119024221.000|CC1|        ISN'T IT?

20110119024224.000|20110119024225.000|CC1|HANGING DOWN, POINTING UP,      
20110119024225.000|20110119024225.000|CC1|    AND JOINING IN THE MIDDLE   
20110119024225.000|20110119024227.000|CC1|        SOME OF THEM.           
20110119024227.000|20110119024227.000|CC1|APPARENTLY IT TAKES ABOUT       
20110119024227.000|20110119024229.000|CC1|100 YEARS FOR THEM TO GROW      
20110119024229.000|20110119024230.000|CC1|    2 1/2 CENTIMETERS.          
20110119024230.000|20110119024231.000|CC1|    THAT'S ROUGHLY AN INCH.

20110119024321.000|20110119024323.000|CC1|    BEER WAS ALWAYS BREWED BY   
20110119024323.000|20110119024324.000|CC1|        MONKS IN ABBEYS.

20110119024608.000|20110119024608.000|CC1|Katy: FROM EUROPE'S CAPITAL TO  
20110119024608.000|20110119024612.000|CC1|ONE OF ITS SMALLEST COUNTRIES.  
20110119024612.000|20110119024612.000|CC1|I'M CROSSING THE BORDER TO      
20110119024612.000|20110119024628.000|CC1|THE GRAND DUCHY OF LUXEMBOURG.  
20110119024628.000|20110119024628.000|CC1|    THE POPULATION OF           
20110119024628.000|20110119024630.000|CC1|LUXEMBOURG'S REALLY SMALL.      
20110119024630.000|20110119024630.000|CC1|IT'S ONLY ABOUT 400,000 PEOPLE, 
20110119024630.000|20110119024633.000|CC1|    AND THIS AREA HERE          
20110119024633.000|20110119024633.000|CC1|    IS REALLY INTO TOURISTS     
20110119024633.000|20110119024637.000|CC1|    BECAUSE THE FAMOUS BATTLE   
20110119024637.000|20110119024637.000|CC1|OF THE BULGE, WHICH TOOK        
20110119024637.000|20110119024639.000|CC1|PLACE IN THE SECOND WORLD WAR,  
20110119024639.000|20110119024639.000|CC1|    HAPPENED ALL AROUND HERE,   
20110119024639.000|20110119024643.000|CC1|    AND I'M DOING A TRAIL,      
20110119024643.000|20110119024643.000|CC1|WHICH IS ABOUT 18 KILOMETERS    
20110119024643.000|20110119024646.000|CC1|LONG, AND IT'S CALLED           
20110119024646.000|20110119024648.000|CC1|THE BATTLE OF THE BULGE TRAIL.  
20110119024648.000|20110119024648.000|CC1|THERE'S NOT THAT MUCH TO SEE    
20110119024648.000|20110119024651.000|CC1|LEFT OVER FROM THE BATTLE       
20110119024651.000|20110119024651.000|CC1|    ITSELF, BUT THERE ARE       
20110119024651.000|20110119024653.000|CC1|THE ODD REMNANTS HERE AND THERE,
20110119024653.000|20110119024653.000|CC1|AND IT'S JUST RALLY NICE TO     
20110119024653.000|20110119024656.000|CC1|GET OUT INTO THE COUNTRYSIDE.   
20110119024656.000|20110119024656.000|CC1|THE BATTLE OF THE BULGE,        
20110119024656.000|20110119024659.000|CC1|OFFICIALLY KNOWN AS THE BATTLE  
20110119024659.000|20110119024659.000|CC1|OF THE ARDENNES, WAS ONE OF     
20110119024659.000|20110119024701.000|CC1|THE FIERCEST AND BLOODIEST      
20110119024701.000|20110119024704.000|CC1|    BATTLES OF WORLD WAR II.    
20110119024704.000|20110119024704.000|CC1|IT TOOK PLACE OVER A LARGE      
20110119024704.000|20110119024707.000|CC1|AREA ACROSS BOTH BELGIUM        
20110119024707.000|20110119024709.000|CC1|        AND LUXEMBOURG.         
20110119024709.000|20110119024709.000|CC1|AS THE ALLIES PUSHED THE NAZIS  
20110119024709.000|20110119024713.000|CC1|BACK TO GERMANY, HITLER THREW   
20110119024713.000|20110119024713.000|CC1|HIS FORCES INTO A DESPERATE     
20110119024713.000|20110119024716.000|CC1|COUNTERATTACK, CREATING A HUGE  
20110119024716.000|20110119024719.000|CC1|BULGE IN THE ALLIED FRONT LINE.
